title: Singular metrics with nonnegative scalar curvature and RCD
authors: Xianzhe Dai, Changliang Wang, Lihe Wang, Guofang Wei
abstract:
We show that a uniformly Euclidean metric with isolated singularity on $M^n =
T^n \# M_0$, where $4\leq n\leq 7$ or $n\geq 4$, $M_0$ spin, and nonnegative
scalar curvature on the smooth part is Ricci flat and extends smoothly over the
singularity. This confirms Schoen's Conjecture in these cases. The key to the
proof is to show that the space has nonnegative synthetic Ricci curvature,
i.e., an $RCD(0, n)$ space. Our result also holds when the singular set
consists of a finite union of submanifolds (of possibly different dimensions)
intersecting transversally under additional assumption on the co-dimension and
the location of the singular set.
